channel.title: Mods
channel.description:
Let's talk about game modifications (other than Black Mesa hurrr). Everyone knows what mods are so there wont be an introduction. They can be finished ones or currently on developement I don't care as long as it isn't Black Mesa.
Mods that I'm currently interested in:
IN DEVELOPMENT[/SIZE]
Dear Esther Remake[/SIZE] ![](upload://bK5mUgVVFacKNcLilcUMXoMAUIf.jpeg) [img]https://www5.picturepush.com/photo/a/3713173/img/DE-29-06-2010/004.jpg[/img] Made by this one guy. He's a professional level designer that made levels for mirrors edge and other games I think. Really bending the source engines capabilites. It's a remake of an artsy mod for HL2 or something. [url]https://www.littlelostpoly.co.uk/devblog/[/url]
Raindrop[/SIZE] ![](upload://5HcMzehpcnsxz5KjxHoSzVv7x0R.jpeg) It's like stalker, but on source. Story has something to do with russia and propaganda videos I guess. [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/raindrop[/url]
Ivan's Secrets[/SIZE] [img]https://www.ivans-secrets.com/media/aks74u_ingame.jpg[/img] It's looks like stalker. Takes place in a desert and aparrently doesn't have FPSbanana users working on it. For source again. [url]https://www.ivans-secrets.com/[/url]
Visage[/SIZE] ![](upload://zwGG0vu0VBQSsADvHLMkJ9LHk29.jpeg) It's blue. Sounds sort of Silent Hill-like. For source again. [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/visage[/url]
RELEASED[/SIZE]
Research and development[/SIZE]
![](upload://nOVmGkDX1AzjwuUF528svbVhMbR.jpeg) A clever puzzle game for Half-Life 2 Episode 2, uses a lot of interesting solutions and concepts. [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/research-and-development[/url]
MINERVA[/SIZE]
[img]https://thegamersjournal.com/fps/pc/metastasis/metastasis_10018.preview.jpg[/img] A very early single player mod for hl2, which has some good level design, but pretty basic visuals. [url]https://www.hylobatidae.org/minerva/[/url]
Now I just posted a bunch of unfinished source mods, but feel free to talk about finished UT3 mods or anything else.
Keep the handy umbrella site for mods in mind: [url='https://www.moddb.com/']ModDb[/url]

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

A great HL2 mod that’s been flying under the radar is Mission Improbable.

And it is now released!
[COLOR=‘DarkOrange’]MISSION IMPROBABLE[/SIZE] [click]

Mission Improbable is a singleplayer mod for Half-Life 2: Episode 2. In it, Gordon Freeman is tasked with re-activating a Resistance listening post. From there, things quickly escalate.

1920×1200 1.54 MB

1920×1200 985 KB

1920×1200 213 KB

1920×1200 483 KB

1920×1200 1.18 MB

Read full topic

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
[COLOR=‘Orange’]G String[/SIZE]
[COLOR=‘Orange’]THE MOD[/SIZE]

https://www.moddb.com/mods/g-string

Haven’t played this one yet, but it’s out now and I’ve been watching it for a while. Graphically it doesn’t look the greatest, but it has kind of a Deus Ex vibe to it. Especially to the plot.

Maybe even System Shock 2-ish with the cyber nannies.

HUD had gone through multiple iterations throughout these screenshots.

720×576 78.1 KB

720×576 66.4 KB

720×576 77.4 KB

960×600 63.2 KB

800×600 69.2 KB

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
Also of great interest to me is Star Wars: The New Era.

“It is produced by Invision Games, a group of modders and Star Wars fans that have evolved from the Movie Battles 2 community and a mod team working on “Star Wars: Source” before. Star Wars: The New Era will give you a tense multiplayer experience for all flavours. Engage in quick Deathmatch battles, fight as a Jedi using the Force or use strategic teamplay in the Team Assault mode.”

Screenshots,

1920×1200 459 KB

1920×1200 334 KB

1920×1200 392 KB

1920×1200 346 KB

Tatooine picture from 2010,

1280×768 689 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
BIG POST[/SIZE]POST[/SIZE]POST[/SIZE]POST[/SIZE]POST[/SIZE]POST(s)[/SIZE]

Mod I’ve spent the most time playing recently, Resistance and Liberation. Current release is Beta 1.6 and it’s a much more solid feeling game with this iteration. Community is pretty strong considering it’s in beta and it’s a niche game that’s more about teamplay than shoot em’ up.

A lot of times it feels almost like RPing.

Screenshots,

1600×900 1.04 MB

1440×900 1.01 MB

Another mod I’m watching is Jurassic Life. Looks pretty promising at being a good Jurassic Park themed game- better than any JP game I’ve seen yet at least, with exception of Telltale’s one from a gameplay standpoint.

Screenshots,

1024×640 555 KB

1024×640 519 KB

1344×840 624 KB

1024×640 579 KB

Now finally, the other mod I’m really happy to see, downloading as I type this, is Deus Ex: New Vision. You may have heard about it before, but they’ve finally got to the first real release (1.0) after 4 years of work. Their estimate is that they have 75% of the game recreated ‘in HD’ now, and they aren’t done yet.

In combination with the DirectX 10 render mod, this one is sure to be a winner.

Screenshots,

1280×720 308 KB

1280×720 237 KB

Read full topic

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: doomyshadowsquirrels
item.description:
lithium.bb:

Is he actually recreating the chambers from scratch, or just copying them and editing them for the P2 engine?

It’s interesting. He takes screenshots in every angle, and measures the dimensions by tiles, then maps it. For most of the escape levels, he’s just decompiling the original maps, with a few simple graphical changes. I think it’s impressive.

I once attempted to create a 2D platform version of Portal, and I landed on the same method. Didn’t work out for me, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Mods
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
If there’s one thing they handled right in the JP film, it was the setting. Mod seems to have captured it flawlessly.

Hope they add the rocket launchers and dart guns from the book. Blowin’ up deenos for fun, tranquilizing 'em because it’d be cute as hell

Also lol @ recycled Kleiner model as Samuel L. Jackson’s character
